name: Fractured Fruits and Vegetables Quiz / Test | Brain Teasers | 15 Questions

questions.explanation:
broccoli.

	Broccoli fights cancer, so we're told.

raspberries.

	I adore expensive French raspberry jam.

cauliflower.

	Cream of cauliflower soup is delicious. I don't care for raw cauliflower, though.

cucumber.

	If you saw the movie "Gosford Park," you saw Maggie Smith put cucumber slices on her closed eyelids as a beauty treatment. Chilled cucumber really does refresh your skin--I've tried it!

potato.

	Gotta love those French fries, potato chips, scalloped potatoes, baked potatoes, mashed potatoes, home fries, hash browns, Tater tots, latkes (potato pancakes), gnocchi (potato dumplings), or you name it. Eat 'em in moderation, though!

tomatoes.

	"Tomatoes shining in the October sun with red hearts...." --Carl Sandburg

romaine lettuce.

	Caesar salad lettuce. I like hearts of romaine best.

red delicious apple.

	Sweet and crisp--I like them in salads.

red bell pepper.

	If you've never tried garlicky roasted red bell pepper slices with olive oil on a piece of baguette with creamy goat cheese, you should!

blueberry.

	My boyfriend cooks them into his morning oatmeal. Have you ever noticed that a blueberry has a little crown on top?

watermelon.

	It's best icy cold. "The black seeds make oval polka dots on the pink meat...." --Carl Sandburg

kiwi.

	Kiwi is such a pretty lime green on the inside. And I like the crunchy seeds. You can decorate custard tarts with kiwi and peach slices, raspberries, and blueberries.

arugula.

	The Gullah language is a Creole of Elizabethan English and African languages. Some African Americans living on U.S. islands off the southeast coast still speak Gullah. Arugula, also called rocket, is an herb related to mustard. It's tangy like mustard, too, and it's good in salads.

questions.correct: jalapeno chili peppers & jalapeno chile peppers & jalapeno chilli peppers & [jalapeño chile peppers & jalapeño chili peppers & jalapeño chilli peppers
questions.explanation:
jalapeno chili peppers & jalapeno chile peppers & jalapeno chilli peppers & [jalapeño chile peppers & jalapeño chili peppers & jalapeño chilli peppers.

	There should be a tilde over the N. "Jalapeno" is an adjective that means "from Jalapa, Mexico." These hot Mexican peppers are small, plump, dark green and VERY spicy!

coconut.

	I love coconut cream pie and macaroons.
